alert.note: Alert for Washington (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 3:50PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Washington County through 445 PM EDT... At 349 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Exeter to near Ledyard. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail and brief torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... South Kingstown, North Kingstown, Westerly, Narragansett, Hopkinton, Charlestown, Richmond and Exeter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
